{{Infobox scientist |name = Kent Smetters |image = Replace this image male.svg |image_size = 150px |caption = |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |residence = [[Philadelphia, PA]] |citizenship = |nationality = |ethnicity = |field = [[Economics]] |work_institutions = [[University of Pennsylvania|University of Pennsylvania's]] [[Wharton School]] |alma_mater = [[Ohio State University]], [[Harvard University]] |doctoral_advisor = |doctoral_students = |known_for = [[Insurance]], [[Risk Management]], [[Social Security (United States)|Social Security]] Policy |influences = |influenced = |prizes = |religion = |footnotes = }} '''Kent Smetters''' is an academic, entrepreneur, and former government official. <ref>[http://www.j-bradford-delong.net/movable_type/2004_archives/000379.html Online Journal on Social Security Reform] retrieved March 4, 2008</ref><ref>[http://www.upenn.edu/almanac/volumes/v55/n10/smetters.html University of Pennsylvania Almanac] retrieved October 28, 2008</ref>
==Early years== Smetters was raised in Ohio. He received his bachelor's degrees in [[Economics]] and [[Computer Science]] from the [[Ohio State University]] in 1990, and Master and PhD degrees in Economics from [[Harvard University]] in 1992 and 1995 respectively.<ref>[http://www.wharton.upenn.edu/faculty/smetters.html Wharton School Faculty] retrieved on March 4, 2008</ref>
== Career == === Academics === Smetters is a Professor of [[Insurance]] and [[Risk Management]] at the [[University of Pennsylvania|University of Pennsylvania's]] [[Wharton School|Wharton School of Business]] and the Joseph E. and Ruth E. Boettner Professor of Financial Gerontology. [[Financial Gerontology]] is the study of aging and related financial and business impacts, applying the functionality of gerontology to the concepts of financial planning. Professor Smetters has written on government [[debt]] and [[Social Security (United States)|Social Security]] policy and has a strong interest in financial planning, analyzing relationships between the economic wellbeing of the elderly and their social, legal, psychological, physical, and environmental well-being. Smetters has also written about the need for insurance industry reform and supports the notion that the private sector should provide [[terrorism insurance]] or protection instead of government.<ref>[http://opim.wharton.upenn.edu/risk/downloads/04-13-HK.pdf Think Tank Publication] retrieved March 8, 2008</ref> He has held visiting appointments with the Department of Economics at [[Stanford University]]. Smetters has also published several papers and chapters with the [[National Bureau of Economic Research]]<ref>[http://www.nber.org/authors/kent_smetters NBER Publications by Kent Smetters] retrieved October 7, 2010</ref>., where he continues to be a Research Associate in Public Economics and Faculty Research Fellow for the Aging Program. Since 2000, he has been with the Michigan Retirement Research Center as a Research Associate.
=== Government and Policy === From 1995-1999, Smetters was an Economist at the [[Congressional Budget Office]]. In 1999, he served as a Consultant for the [[World Bank]]. He became Deputy Assistant Secretary for Economic Policy of the [[United States Treasury]] in 2001, where he stayed on for another year as a Consultant. He was also a Member of the Blue Ribbon Advisory Panel on Dynamic Scoring, [[U.S. Congress]] from 2002-2003. He is a visiting scholar of the [[American Enterprise Institute]] for Public Policy Research.
=== RotoHog === He co-founded Sports Composite DE, Inc. with [[David Wu (entrepreneur)|David Wu]] in 2006 which developed the [[RotoHog]] fantasy sports game. RotoHog is a digital platform developer that designs, implements and markets fantasy services for media and advertising partners. The company builds, delivers and manages co-branded fantasy sports games for major media companies, sports companies and professional sports leagues.
RotoHog is also the provider of nba.com's NBA Stock Exchange and commissioner games.<ref>[http://www.nba.com/global/top_10_fantasy_picks_071011.html NBA reference to partnership with RotoHog] retrieved October 7, 2010</ref> In 2009, RotoHog began to provide games for Fox Sports in Spanish and the AVP Pro Beach Volleyball tour.<ref>[http://www.socaltech.com/rotohog_signs_fox_sports_on_latin_american_deal/s-0020575.html RotoHog Signs Fox Sports On Latin American Deal] retrieved October 7, 2010</ref><ref>[http://www.mediapost.com/publications/?fa=Articles.showArticle&art_aid=101626 Pro Beach Volleyball Taps RotoHog To Create Fantasy Game] retrieved October 7, 2010</ref> Smetters is no longer with the company but serves on the Board of Advisors.<ref>[http://www.toacorn.com/news/2007/0222/Sports/073.html Fantasy Sports' New Marketplace] retrieved March 4, 2008</ref><ref>[http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=36477744 Online Business Magazine Profile: Kent Smetters] retrieved March 4, 2008</ref> <ref>[http://www.entrepreneur.com/magazine/entrepreneur/2008/may/192752.html Entrepreneur Magazine: A Partnership Success Story] retrieved 21st April 2008</ref>
=== Veritat Advisors, Inc === After several years in the financial industry, Smetters co-founded the company [[Veritat Advisors]].<ref>[http://www.veritat.com Veritat Advisors] retrieved October 6, 2010</ref> Smetters is the President of Veritat Advisors.
Veritat positions itself as one of the first financial advisory firms to deliver full-service and objective [[financial planning]] <ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EMDomYykgeg&feature=youtu.be. Fox Business News: How Online Financial Planning Works] retrieved August 16, 2010</ref> at an affordable price. A key competitive feature of Veritat is its simple and transparent pricing.<ref>[http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748703988304575413422740203834.html?mod=wsj_share_twitter Low-Cost Financial Planning: The Next Wave] retrieved August 7, 2010</ref>
